info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 12 at 12:33PM EDT until August 13 at 9:40AM EDT by NWS Raleigh NC
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in North Carolina...
Neuse River At Smithfield affecting Johnston County.
Neuse River Near Clayton affecting Johnston County.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Neuse River near Clayton.
* WHEN...Until late tomorrow morning.
* IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor flooding begins. Minor overflow occurs on both banks. Water reaches the edge of the Neuse River Greenway trail. At 10.0 feet, Upstream of the gage site, the Neuse River Greenway at Covered Bridge Road begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Flooding will close the Neuse River Greenway trail.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:15 PM EDT Tuesday the stage was 11.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening and continue falling to 5.2 feet Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.6 feet on 09/16/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/rah/rivers.
The next statement will be issued Wednesday morning.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TOMORROW MORNING
